required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Mifepristone Compared to Placebo as an Adjunct to Transcervical Balloon for Labor Induction: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this trial is to explore mifepristone as an option for induction of labor at term by evaluating the efficacy of mifepristone use for cervical preparation. Since the Labor Induction versus Expectant Management in Low-Risk Nulliparous Women (ARRIVE) trial supporting that elective induction after 39 weeks decreases cesarean sections and morbidity, rates of elective term inductions are increasing.
At Lucile Packard Children's Hospital at Stanford University specifically, approximately 40% of spontaneous vaginal deliveries follow induction of labor, with an average induction time of 20 hours. Previous studies have established the maternal and neonatal safety of mifepristone in term inductions, however, this study will assess the difference in overall time from induction to complete cervical dilation, delivery, and the total time on Labor and Delivery.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Time from Start of Labor Induction to Complete Cervical Dilation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 72 hours after the start of labor induction
primary_outcome.description: Time from initiation of labor induction to first documented, complete cervical dilation (10 cm dilation).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Start of Labor Induction to Delivery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 72 hours after the start of labor induction
Up to approximately 1 week after hospital admission for delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Time from admission for delivery up to the time of hospital discharge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 72 hours after the start of labor induction

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of patients able to achieve active labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 72 hours after the start of labor induction
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of patients able to achieve active labor (6cm cervical dilation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Sustained uterine tachysystole for at least 30 minutes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 72 hours after the start of labor induction

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite of serious maternal morbidity or death
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 1 week after hospital admission for delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with serious maternal morbidity or death based on CDC criteria for major maternal morbidity and mortality

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Satisfaction scored with a numerical rating from 1-5
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 1 day post-partum, up to approximately 15 minutes to complete the survey
secondary_outcome.description: Compare patient satisfaction from a rating of 1-5 (with higher numbers indicating higher satisfaction)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of category 2 or 3 fetal heart rate tracings
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 72 hours after the start of labor induction
At 1 minute and 5 minutes of infant life (approximately 10 seconds to perform each assessment)
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the APGAR scores (at 1 and 5 minutes). The Apgar score comprises five components: 1) color, 2) heart rate, 3) reflexes, 4) muscle tone, and 5) respiration, each of which is given a score of 0, 1, or 2. The score is reported at 1 minute and 5 minutes after birth for all infants,

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within approximately 2 hours after delivery (approximately 5 minutes to obtain sample)
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory values for neonatal arterial cord blood pH

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite of serious neonatal morbidity or perinatal death
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with serious neonatal morbidity or perinatal death

arm_group.description: Participants will be given mifepristone with insertion of the cervical Cook balloon for labor induction
Participants will be given a placebo with insertion of the cervical Cook balloon for labor induction

intervention.description: Placebo to match mifepristone taken orally

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant patients between ages 18 to 45 years
- Singleton, live gestation
- Nulliparous
- Gestational age between 37 weeks 0 days - 42 weeks 0 days
- Fetus in cephalic presentation
- Patients admitted for labor induction
- Patients who are not in labor with intact membranes
- Patients with no contraindication for vaginal delivery (placenta previa, vasa previa, active genital herpes)
- Patients with no contraindications for mifepristone (undiagnosed adnexal mass, chronic adrenal failure, concurrent long-term corticosteroid therapy, history of allergy to mifepristone, or other prostaglandins, hemorrhagic disorders or concurrent anticoagulant therapy, inherited porphyria, or an intrauterine device (IUD) in place)
- Patients with a Bishop score <6 at time of randomization
- Transcervical balloon in place <3 hours prior to the time of randomization without prior cervical preparation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant cardiac, renal, or hepatic maternal comorbidities, severe gestational hypertension or preeclampsia with severe features
- Pregnancies complicated by major fetal anomalies
- Patients with a uterine scar
- Pregnancies complicated by fetal growth restriction (Estimated fetal weight <10%)
- Pregnancies complicated by oligohydramnios
- Fetuses with an estimated fetal weight >4500 gm by recent ultrasound or Leopold's exam on admission
- Patients with morbid obesity (BMI >40)
- Fetuses with a category 2 or 3 fetal heart tracing at labor induction admission
- Vaginal bleeding at the time of randomization
- Any indication for scheduled CD
- Hypersensitivity to oxytocin
- Uterine contractions equal to or greater than 5 in 10 minutes for sustained 30 minutes
- Lactose allergy
